'''Bibarel''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ビーダル''' ''Beadaru'') is a dual-type {{2t|Normal|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation IV]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Bidoof}} starting at [[level]] 15.

==Biology==
Bibarel is a bulky, bipedal Pokémon similar to a beaver. Brown fur covers most of this Pokémon with a tan circle on its chest. Its face is covered by a tan mask with a rounded extension over each eye; the male will have an additional extension to the side of each eye. While its forepaws are small and slightly webbed, its hind paws are larger and more rounded. Both sets of paws are black with three toes, but the hind paws have circular, tan paw pads. Bibarel's large, flat tail is black with a tan, wavy marking near the tip. Rounded tufts of fur line each side of its face. Its short, dark brown snout has a small red nose and protruding upper incisors. These teeth are used for chewing trees. This Pokémon is known to be an industrious worker that dams rivers by building its nest. However, a river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow. It is slow moving and awkward out of water, but a swift swimmer.

==In the anime==
[[File:Reggie Bibarel.png|thumb|left|210px|Bibarel in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Bibarel appeared in ''[[DP057|Bibarel Gnaws Best!]]'', under the ownership of [[Isis]]. It refused to help build a bridge because it knew it was structurally unstable.

[[Paul]]'s brother, [[Reggie]], owns a Bibarel, which appeared in ''[[DP066|Lost Leader Strategy!]]''. Reggie used Bibarel in his battle against {{Ash}}; it battled {{AP|Turtwig}}, but was eventually defeated.

===Minor appearances===
Bibarel debuted in brief cameos in ''[[DP001|Following A Maiden's Voyage!]]'', where they appeared in the wild.

A Bibarel made a small appearance in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]'' as one of the Pokémon {{OBP|Darkrai|M10}} hit with a {{m|Dark Void}}.

Multiple Bibarel appeared in a brief cameo in ''[[M11|Giratina and the Sky Warrior]]''.

Bibarel made cameo appearances in ''[[XY001|Kalos, Where Dreams and Adventures Begin!]]'', ''[[XY021|A PokéVision of Things to Come!]]'', ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]'', and ''[[XY031|The Cave of Trials!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Bibarel appeared in ''[[XY061|An Oasis of Hope!]]''.

A Bibarel appeared in ''[[PK27|Pikachu and the Pokémon Music Squad]]''.

A Trainer's Bibarel appeared in ''[[XY096|A Giga Battle with Mega Results!]]''.

A Trainer's Bibarel appeared in ''[[XY111|Unlocking Some Respect!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Socialite Bibarel Adventures.png|thumb|125px|Bibarel in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Bibarel appeared alongside a nameless {{tc|Madame|Socialite}} at the [[Seven Stars Restaurant]] in ''[[PS361|Bombastic Bibarel & Heroic Hippopotas]]'', along with a {{tc|Gentleman}} and his {{p|Hippowdon}}. The quartet battled {{adv|Diamond}}'s {{p|Torterra}}, [[Tru]], and {{adv|Pearl}}'s {{p|Infernape}}, [[Chimler]] in a [[Multi Battle|Tag Battle]].

A Trainer's Bibarel appeared in ''[[PS365|Crafty Carnivine]]'' and ''[[PS423|Tackling Togekiss]]''.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
Multiple Bibarel appeared in a flashback in ''[[DPAS1|Deoxys, The Phantom Pokémon! (Part 1)]]''.

==Trivia==
* No other Pokémon has the same [[type]] [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|combination]] as Bibarel.

===Origin===
Bibarel is based on a {{wp|beaver}}.

====Name origin====
Bibarel may be a combination of ''beaver'' or ''Biber'' (German for ''beaver'') and ''barrel''. It may also refer to ''bib'' (which is similar to the pattern on Bibarel's front) or a transliteration of ビーバー ''biibaa'' (beaver).

Beadaru is a combination of ''beaver'' and 樽 ''taru'' (barrel).
